headline: 'I've got morons on my team': Sen. Mitt Romney hits Reps. Paul Gosar, Marjorie Taylor Greene
author: Ronald J. Hansen
sentences:

Rep. Adam Kinzinger, R-Ill., added his voice to the pushback from the right against AFPAC and those who have not unconditionally condemned Putin.

Appearing on CNN's "State of the Union," Romney, R-Utah, unleashed on the pair for participating Friday in the America First Political Action Committee organized by Nick Fuentes, an anti-immigration activist who has been dubbed a white supremacist by federal prosecutors.

Gosar and Greene last year briefly sparked a firestorm over reports they intended to launch an America First Caucus with a focus on keeping the nation loyal to an Anglo-Saxon past and ending immigration as we know it.

Romney, who is finding newfound appreciation for his 2012 judgment that Russian President Vladimir Putin was the top geopolitical foe of the United States, was asked about "good and evil" that is "closer to home."

Sen. Mitt Romney on Sunday likened Reps. Paul Gosar and Marjorie Taylor Greene to "morons" and said they were "missing a few IQ points" after their participation in a political event led by a white nationalist.

I’m also not going to turn down the opportunity to speak to 1,200 young America First patriots because of a few off-color remarks by another speaker, even if I find those remarks unsavory," she wrote.
In a social media post Thursday, Gosar blamed President Joe Biden for the Russian invasion of Ukraine and took the same position on prospective Ukrainian membership in NATO as Putin.
Romney defended a tweet by Rep. Liz Cheney, R-Wyo., in which she said the silence by Republican leaders after Gosar and Greene's words "was deafening and enabling.
In a written statement to The Republic, Gosar dismissed Romney's assessment as reflective of an irrelevant and shrinking political constituency.
